titleStmt.title: Whereas we are informed that the price of corn, and all sorts of grain, meale and malt, is grown excessive high in several parts of this kingdom, which doth arise as is conceived from the great quantities of corn which have been of late carried out of this kingdom, into forreign parts ... by the Lord Deputy and Council, Arran.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy.
Arran, Richard Butler, Earl of, d. 1686.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Benjamin Took ... and are to be sold by Mary Crook ...,

notesStmt.note: Title from first 7 lines of text.
Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
Date of publication suggested by Wing.
"Given at the Council chamber in Dublin the fifth day of May 1684."
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
